text: The beast lets out a low snarl and bursts from the undergrowth. The ground trembles as dead leaves scatter into the air.
I instinctively raise my pack to shield myself, but the creature’s strength far exceeds what I expected. In the next instant, I’m thrown backward, hitting the ground hard.
Pain explodes across my chest like a stone crushing down. My breath catches. The pack is torn open by its claws, scraps of cloth and dust flying everywhere.
Before I can scramble up, a sharp sound slices through the air. Alicia charges forward—silver light flashes—and the monster is cut down in a single stroke, dissolving into ash.
The air fills with the scent of scorch and blood. Firelight flickers along her blade.
“Hey!” Her voice is sharper than usual. Before I can answer, she’s at my side, kneeling and pulling me upright. “Are you hurt? Talk to me.”
I cough, forcing a weak smile. “I’m… fine. Just got knocked around.”
She frowns, her hand still gripping my shoulder. “Are you sure? Don’t pretend.”
Her expression is tight and serious—nothing like her usual calm detachment. Only after she’s certain I can sit upright does she slowly release her hold, exhaling softly.
“Next time, don’t try to take it head-on. Understood?”
I nod. Though her tone is steady, she pats my arm lightly, as if reassuring herself that I’m still alive.
The forest falls quiet again. Only a scorched mark remains where the creature stood. Alicia looks at the blackened earth, her voice lowering.
“These things aren’t born naturally. They’re ‘Lingering Dreams’—traces left behind by those who died.”
“Lingering Dreams?” I repeat, still catching my breath.
“Yes. In places where battles were fought and people died, their final emotions seep into the ground. Given time, they become creatures like this.”
After a pause, she glances back at me, her voice softening. “You really scared me just now.”
She offers her hand to help me up, brushing dust from my back. Her smile is faint—but warmer than the firelight.
“Can you walk?”
I move my arm carefully and nod. “Yeah. I can.”
She smiles slightly. “Good. The market’s just ahead. Let’s get that looked at.”
